column4: Oh that's what I've already got, lol. At least I'm pretty sure, since I use Putty to throw commands and whatnot.

Works fine so far... I just can't figure out proper code to setup VLC for live transcoding, so I tried to get a GUI up to do it that way... But that didn't work, haha. I just ultimately need to figure out a proper way to do live Icecast transcoding. x.x
It looked pretty during the time I could see it though. :D
I don't have lubuntu (I assume that's short for light ubuntu) but I wish I did, lol.
BRB, smoke break before I go through the process of figuring out how to properly transcode live streams. x.x
It's ubuntu with the LXDE desktop env  (this is lighter)

nothing regarding Ubuntu anymore really. I'm tying to get VLC to do live transcoding of an Icecast stream in OGG to MP3 and push it to another Icecast mount... But I can't figure out the code for command-line. I tried installing a GUI to use VLC's GUI but that ate too much RAM and made my system unuseable, so I'm back at step one, lol.
do you have 32 or 64 bit Ubuntu?
amd64 if for 64 bit soft/hard ware
with the packages we can't install?
where did you get liquidsoap from?  the version in the repos does not depend on libao2
Still going to help me monsieur?
